predictions:

article:
X owner Elon Musk has agreed to reinstate the account of controversial commentator Nick Fuentes, with the tech mogul saying he believes it’s better to have contentious views aired openly on the platform where they can be subjected to scrutiny and debate rather than to “grow simmering in the darkness.”

“He has been banned since 2021, what happened to your promise big guy?” the GoyaBeanGroyper account posted.

In response to the post calling for Mr. Fuentes’s reinstatement, Mr. Musk responded in the affirmative.

Mr. Musk’s decision was generally met with positive reactions from accounts that advocate for free speech, including from Babylon Bee founder and CEO Seth Dillon.

Ian Miles Cheong, a popular conservative commentator and social media influencer, took to X in praise of the decision.

Mr. Fuentes did not respond to a request for comment on the reinstatement.

“Free Nick Fuentes,” he said. “Give me my [expletive] Twitter back.”

Elsewhere in the podcast, Mr. Sosnick read out a bio of Mr. Fuentes that labeled him as a Holocaust denier, an anti-Semite, and a “white Christian nationalist.”

President Trump later said he didn’t know who Mr. Fuentes was and expressed surprise at the three additional dinner guests as he expected Mr. West to come by himself.

“Kanye West very much wanted to visit Mar-a-Lago,“ President Trump wrote in a post on Truth Social at the time. ”Our dinner meeting was intended to be Kanye and me only, but he arrived with a guest whom I had never met and knew nothing about.”

Some Republicans were publicly critical of President Trump’s judgment for meeting with Mr. West and Mr. Fuentes.

“There is no room in the Republican Party for anti-Semitism or white supremacy, and anyone meeting with people advocating that point of view, in my judgement, [is] highly unlikely to ever be elected president of the United States,” Mr. McConnell said at a press conference.

The Republican senator later added that this “would apply to all of the leaders in the party who will be seeking offices.”

Rep. James Comer (R-Ky.) told NBC that President Trump “needs better judgment in who he dines with,“ adding, “I would not take a meeting with that person,” referring to Mr. Fuentes. “I wouldn’t take a meeting with Kanye West, either.”

President Trump later told Fox News that he had “no idea” what Mr. Fuentes’s views were and that those views “weren’t expressed at the table in our very quick dinner, or it wouldn’t have been accepted.”
